meanings.definition: The process of making something or someone more masculine.
meanings.sent1: The masculinization of the character in the story made him stronger and more confident.
meanings.sent2: The masculinization of the clothing line aimed to attract more male customers.
meanings.sent3: The sudden masculinization of the flower garden with all the blue flowers was quite unexpected.
meanings.sent4: His deep voice was a clear sign of the masculinization that had taken place during puberty.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting captured the essence of masculinization with its bold and strong brush strokes.

meanings.definition: The development of male characteristics in an organism.
meanings.sent1: The masculinization of the baby chicks was evident as they started to grow larger combs.
meanings.sent2: Researchers studied the masculinization of the fish population in the polluted river.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected masculinization of the kitten's meow surprised everyone in the room.
meanings.sent4: The masculinization of the tree's branches gave it a more robust and sturdy appearance.
meanings.sent5: The gradual masculinization of the protagonist throughout the novel mirrored his inner growth and strength.
